body:
Using numpy.ma returns a mask. That is, it hides (masks) everything that fits the condition weather < downtime. If you want to show everything that fits the condition, just invert the condition:

data = np.array([0,1,2,3,4])
weather = np.array([0,60,120,180,0])
downtime = 120
data_masked = np.ma.masked_where(weather >= downtime, data)
data_masked

Then the output will be:

masked_array(data = [0 1 -- -- 4], 
             mask = [False False  True  True False],
             fill_value = 999999)

To access the data, use data_masked.data.
title: Python help using 'numpy.masked_where' conditionally from another list
